p: During isolation, the major compounds, as well as the active compounds in the antibacterial assay, as revealed through bioassay-guided fraction, were targeted ( Figure 2) and are discussed here collectively. The chemical profiles ( Figure S1) suggested that compounds yielding fragment ions at m/z 229 (Rt 2.83 min), m/z 469 (Rt 3.72 min) and m/z 469 (Rt 4.14 min) were the major constituents of the T. sericea root bark extract, with the last two as marker compounds responsible for the chemical variations observed in the loadings plot ( Figure 1C). These three compounds were isolated chromatographically and identified by NMR analysis.
